sentences.sentence: Its reason, to eventually prosecute Russian officials responsible for the war.

sentences.sentence: And Russia's Wagner paramilitary group says its forces have practically encircled it. Almost 700 kilometers away, a city mourns the loss of one of its soldiers, who went missing over a year ago when fighting began. For a long time, its relatives held out hope that he was captured but alive. And his child was named Vera for belief in his owner.

sentences.sentence: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz arriving at the White House on Friday for a private meeting

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: with President Biden. And is Kiev and Moscow ready for spring offensives, a show of unity from the two leaders over their ongoing support for Ukraine, including a further $400 million in U.S. assistance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: You've driven historic changes at home and, you know, increasing defense spending and diversifying away from Russian energy sources.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Together, we work lockstep to supply critical security assistance in Ukraine and everything from what we've done in lockstep, ammunition, artillery, armored tanks, air defense systems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And the Transatlantic Partnership is really in very good shape today and this is very much thanks to your leadership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So I'm really happy to be here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Washington and Berlin have worked closely on sending military and humanitarian aid to Kyiv but previously clashed over the issue of providing tanks. Recovery teams have spent a third day scoring through the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: wreckage in Temp, Greece, the site of Tuesday's devastating train crash. The bodies were identified with next-of-kin DNA samples and were returned to loved ones in closed caskets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Some relatives are still waiting outside a hospital in the central city of Larissa for test results. I was in a car that saved many children. I call all the children who came out of this car, if we saw them, in the 22nd place.

sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in Athens, some 2,000 students took to the streets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They, alongside unions and rail workers, accused the government of neglecting the railway system for years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, it says that the crash was due to human error.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Messages of, it was not an accident, it was a murder, could be read among the signs, written in red paint next to government buildings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Some threw petrol bombs and set garbage bins on fire, while officers responded with volleys of tear gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Many of the 350 passengers on the train were university students themselves. For a pair of siblings in Italy, the crime business was truly

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: a family affair. Rosalia Messina, the sister of a top Sicilian mafia boss, was arrested on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Her charge? Helping her brother run his criminal operation while he was hiding. Her brother and top mafia boss, Mateo Massina-Dener, was arrested in January after spending three decades on the run. He has since been tried for dozens of murders, including a pair of 1992 bombings that killed top anti-mafia prosecutors.
